definitions.definition: A disk, usually made of a polymer, used to record sound for playback on a phonograph.
An item of information put into a temporary or permanent physical medium.
definitions.example: The person had a record of the interview so she could review her notes.

definitions.definition: Any instance of a physical medium on which information was put for the purpose of preserving it and making it available for future reference.
definitions.example: We have no record of you making this payment to us.

definitions.definition: A set of data relating to a single individual or item.
The most extreme known value of some variable, particularly that of an achievement in competitive events.
definitions.example: The heat and humidity were both new records.

definitions.definition: To make a record of information.
definitions.example: I wanted to record every detail of what happened, for the benefit of future generations.

definitions.definition: To make an audio or video recording of.
definitions.example: Within a week they had recorded both the song and the video for it.

definitions.definition: To give legal status to by making an official public record.
definitions.example: When the deed was recorded, we officially owned the house.

definitions.definition: To fix in a medium, usually in a tangible medium.
To make an audio, video, or multimedia recording.
To sing or repeat a tune.
